alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for tonight into Monday morning.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Beginning this evening and tapering off Monday morning.

Discussion:
Snow associated with a passing weather system will begin late this afternoon or early evening and intensify tonight. Conditions should gradually improve Monday morning. Confidence in exact snowfall amounts is low at this point.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for today.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm. Higher amounts are possible.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Beginning this morning and ending tonight or early Monday morning.

Additional information:
Snow associated with a passing weather system will begin this morning over northwestern Ontario and by early this afternoon for areas north of Lake Superior. Snow will taper off from west to east tonight into early Monday morning.

Confidence in exact snowfall amounts for this event is low. It is possible that some areas will receive in excess of 15 cm. The area is being monitored for potential snowfall warnings.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 15 to 25 cm. The highest amounts are most likely over areas of higher terrain.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
This morning through Monday morning.

Additional information:
Snow associated with a passing weather system will begin this morning for areas west of Lake Superior and by early this afternoon for areas to the north of the lake. Snowfall amounts will likely be highly variable, with the highest amounts expected over areas of higher terrain. Snow will taper off late tonight or early Monday morning.

###

Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for today.

What:
Snowfall amounts near 10 cm. 
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Today, and ending tonight or early Monday morning.

Additional information:
Snow associated with a passing weather system is affecting portions of northwestern Ontario. Snow will taper off from west to east tonight into early Monday morning.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm.
Reduced visibility in areas of heavier snow.

When:
Beginning tonight and tapering Monday evening.

Discussion:
Areas east of Lake Superior will see closer to 10 cm of snow and areas northeast of Georgian Bay will see closer to 15 cm of snow.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
